decks.notes: This aggro Death and Taxes deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with control and disruption cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Lightning Bolt to disrupt opponents and win quickly. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Consign to Memory for additional reach. The mana base is crafted to support a variety of colors and provide consistency in mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with threats while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards to quickly ramp up mana, control the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures, and leverage the Broodscale's ability to continually grow in power with the Blade of the Bloodchief. With a mix of versatile spells and utility lands, the deck aims to assemble key pieces to create a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo strategy that can quickly close out the game.

The focus of this deck is to use the Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp up mana production and play powerful lands such as Urza's Saga and Primeval Titan. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Scapeshift, the deck aims to assemble a strong board presence and win condition through the deployment of various lands and powerful creatures. The inclusion of cards like Gruul Turf and Lotus Field allows for additional mana acceleration and versatility, while spells like Green Sun's Zenith and Cultivator Colossus provide additional utility and win condition options.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan with disruptive spells. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by using removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply pressure. Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional utility and disruption, allowing you to outmaneuver your opponent and secure a swift victory. Additionally, March of Otherworldly Light and Wrath of the Skies can act as finishers if the game goes long.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield, supported by disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with fast, efficient threats like Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Kozilek's Command. By utilizing mana acceleration from Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls, the deck can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of disruptive creatures and removal spells, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck looks to control the board state with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude, while utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes powerful value cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory to generate card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Phage and Ragavan to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes various control elements such as Consign to Memory and Solitude to deal with threats. Additionally, cards like Ephemerate and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide value by recurring key creatures or spells. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure smooth gameplay and the ability to cast the deck's diverse array of spells.

The deck aims to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions, while using card draw and filtering to find key combo pieces. It utilizes Ral, Monsoon Mage for additional card advantage and to generate a storm count. Past in Flames is used to recur key spells from the graveyard, and Wrenn's Resolve helps protect against disruption. The combo finish involves casting multiple spells in a turn to generate a storm count, then utilizing Wish to find and cast a game-ending spell. The deck's explosive mana generation and card draw make it capable of winning the game in a single turn.

The deck aims to generate a lot of mana quickly through rituals and medallions, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a turn. Ral, Monsoon Mage is used to dig through the deck for combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for spells to be recast from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Wish and Glimpse the Impossible for added versatility and card draw. Ultimately, the goal is to storm off and finish the game with a big Grapeshot or other burn spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Slickshot Show-Off to apply pressure and control the board. By using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to create a fast and powerful tempo advantage, allowing the player to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to ensure consistency.

This deck focuses on using the interaction between Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate a powerful creature that can overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Malevolent Rumble, as well as Urza's Saga to search for key pieces, the deck aims to create a dominant board presence. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a powerful finisher while cards like Vexing Bauble and Ancient Stirrings help find the necessary combo pieces. With a mix of ramp, control, and synergy, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive playstyle while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury while also controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory. The deck also has some card advantage and recursion with cards like Ephemerate and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The mana base is built to support multiple colors and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly to cast powerful spells and combo off with Ral, Monsoon Mage. It includes cards to help filter and draw into the combo pieces, as well as ways to recur spells from the graveyard to continue the combo. The deck also includes cards for additional damage and protection to help secure the win. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful storm of spells.

This Aggro UR deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board, while also manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Expressive Iteration. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its fast-paced aggression and efficient card selection, supported by lands like Wooded Foothills and Scalding Tarn to ensure consistency in mana base. The deck's strategy is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures and spells that aim to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide support for the aggressive strategy by controlling the board and enhancing creature abilities. Consign to Memory and Thundering Falls offer additional removal and disruption options, while Stubborn Denial helps protect key threats. The deck's mana base allows for consistent and fast play, with a focus on casting creatures early and often.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting opponents through a combination of powerful creatures and card advantage. By assembling the UrzaTron lands, the deck can quickly ramp into big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and out value the opponent to secure victory.
